recipe.title: Teriyaki Chicken Casserole
recipe.instructions: <action>Preheat</action> oven to 350° F. <action>Spray</action> a 9x13-inch baking pan with non-stick <action>spray</action>. <action>Combine</action> soy sauce, ½ cup water, brown sugar, ginger and garlic in a small saucepan and <action>cover</action>. <action>Bring</action> to a <action>boil</action> over medium <action>heat</action>. <action>Remove</action> lid and <action>cook</action> for one minute once boiling. Meanwhile, <action>stir</action> together the corn starch and 2 tablespoons of water in a separate dish until smooth. Once sauce is boiling, <action>add</action> mixture to the saucepan and <action>stir</action> to <action>combine</action>. <action>Cook</action> until the sauce starts to <action>thicken</action> then <action>remove</action> from <action>heat</action>. <action>Place</action> the chicken breasts in the prepared pan. <action>Pour</action> one cup of the sauce over <action>top</action> of chicken. <action>Place</action> chicken in oven and <action>bake</action> 35 minutes or until cooked through. <action>Remove</action> from oven and <action>shred</action> chicken in the dish using two forks. *Meanwhile, <action>steam</action> or <action>cook</action> the vegetables according to package directions. <action>Add</action> the cooked vegetables and rice to the casserole dish with the chicken. <action>Add</action> most of the remaining sauce, reserving a bit to <action>drizzle</action> over the <action>top</action> when serving. <action>Gently</action> <action>toss</action> everything together in the casserole dish until combined. <action>Return</action> to oven and <action>cook</action> 15 minutes. <action>Remove</action> from oven and <action>let</action> stand 5 minutes before serving. <action>Drizzle</action> each serving with remaining sauce. <action>Enjoy</action>!

recipe.title: BeaverTails
recipe.instructions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, <action>add</action> <action>warm</action> water, a big pinch of sugar and yeast. <action>Allow</action> to <action>sit</action> until frothy. Into the same bowl, <action>add</action> 1/2 cup sugar, <action>warm</action> milk, melted butter, eggs and <action>salt</action>, and <action>whisk</action> until combined. <action>Place</action> a dough hook on the mixer, <action>add</action> the flour with the machine on, until a smooth but slightly sticky dough forms. <action>Place</action> dough in a bowl, <action>cover</action> with plastic wrap, and <action>allow</action> to <action>proof</action> for 1 1/2 hours. <action>Cut</action> dough into 12 pieces, and roll out into long oval-like shapes about 1/4 inch thick that resemble a beaver’s tail. In a large, deep pot, <action>heat</action> oil to 350 degrees. <action>Gently</action> <action>place</action> beavertail dough into hot oil and <action>cook</action> for 30 to 45 seconds on each side until golden brown. <action>Drain</action> on paper towels, and <action>garnish</action> as desired. <action>Toss</action> in cinnamon sugar, in white sugar with a squeeze of lemon, or with a generous slathering of Nutella and a handful of toasted almonds. <action>Enjoy</action>!

recipe.title: Big Mac
recipe.instructions: For the Big Mac sauce, <action>combine</action> all the ingredients in a bowl, <action>season</action> with <action>salt</action> and <action>chill</action> until ready to use. 2. To make the patties, <action>season</action> the <action>mince</action> with <action>salt</action> and <action>pepper</action> and <action>form</action> into 4 balls using about 1/3 cup <action>mince</action> each. <action>Place</action> each onto a square of baking paper and <action>flatten</action> to <action>form</action> into four x 15cm circles. <action>Heat</action> oil in a large frypan over high <action>heat</action>. In 2 batches, <action>cook</action> beef patties for 1-2 minutes each side until <action>lightly</action> charred and cooked through. <action>Remove</action> from <action>heat</action> and <action>keep</action> <action>warm</action>. <action>Repeat</action> with remaining two patties. 3. <action>Carefully</action> <action>slice</action> each burger bun into three acrossways, then <action>lightly</action> <action>toast</action>. 4. To <action>assemble</action> the burgers, <action>spread</action> a little Big Mac sauce over the bottom base. <action>Top</action> with some chopped onion, shredded lettuce, <action>slice</action> of cheese, beef patty and some pickle slices. <action>Top</action> with the middle bun <action>layer</action>, and <action>spread</action> with more Big Mac sauce, onion, lettuce, pickles, beef patty and then <action>finish</action> with more sauce. <action>Top</action> with burger lid to <action>serve</action>. 5. After waiting half an hour for your food to <action>settle</action>, <action>go</action> for a <action>jog</action>.

recipe.title: Corba
recipe.instructions: <action>Pick</action> through your lentils for any foreign debris, <action>rinse</action> them 2 or 3 times, <action>drain</action>, and <action>set</action> aside. Fair warning, this will probably turn your lentils into a solid block that you’ll have to <action>break</action> up later In a large pot over medium-high <action>heat</action>, sauté the olive oil and the onion with a pinch of <action>salt</action> for about 3 minutes, then <action>add</action> the carrots and <action>cook</action> for another 3 minutes. <action>Add</action> the tomato paste and <action>stir</action> it around for around 1 minute. Now <action>add</action> the cumin, paprika, mint, thyme, black <action>pepper</action>, and red <action>pepper</action> as quickly as you can and <action>stir</action> for 10 seconds to <action>bloom</action> the spices. <action>Congratulate</action> yourself on how amazing your house now smells. Immediately <action>add</action> the lentils, water, broth, and <action>salt</action>. <action>Bring</action> the soup to a (gentle) <action>boil</action>. After it has come to a <action>boil</action>, <action>reduce</action> <action>heat</action> to medium-low, <action>cover</action> the pot halfway, and <action>cook</action> for 15-20 minutes or until the lentils have fallen apart and the carrots are completely cooked. After the soup has cooked and the lentils are tender, <action>blend</action> the soup either in a blender or simply use a hand blender to reach the consistency you desire. <action>Taste</action> for seasoning and <action>add</action> more <action>salt</action> if necessary. <action>Serve</action> with crushed-up crackers, torn up bread, or something else to <action>add</action> some extra thickness. You could also use a traditional thickener (like cornstarch or flour), but I prefer to <action>add</action> crackers for some texture and saltiness. Makes great leftovers, stays good in the fridge for about a week.

recipe.title: Beef and Mustard Pie
recipe.instructions: <action>Preheat</action> the oven to 150C/300F/Gas 2. <action>Toss</action> the beef and flour together in a bowl with some <action>salt</action> and black <action>pepper</action>. <action>Heat</action> a large casserole until hot, <action>add</action> half of the rapeseed oil and enough of the beef to just <action>cover</action> the bottom of the casserole. <action>Fry</action> until browned on each side, then <action>remove</action> and <action>set</action> aside. <action>Repeat</action> with the remaining oil and beef. <action>Return</action> the beef to the pan, <action>add</action> the wine and <action>cook</action> until the volume of liquid has reduced by half, then <action>add</action> the stock, onion, carrots, thyme and mustard, and <action>season</action> well with <action>salt</action> and <action>pepper</action>. <action>Cover</action> with a lid and <action>place</action> in the oven for two hours. <action>Remove</action> from the oven, <action>check</action> the seasoning and <action>set</action> aside to <action>cool</action>. <action>Remove</action> the thyme. When the beef is <action>cool</action> and you're ready to <action>assemble</action> the pie, <action>preheat</action> the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. <action>Transfer</action> the beef to a pie dish, <action>brush</action> the rim with the beaten egg yolks and lay the pastry over the <action>top</action>. <action>Brush</action> the <action>top</action> of the pastry with more beaten egg. <action>Trim</action> the pastry so there is just enough excess to <action>crimp</action> the edges, then <action>place</action> in the oven and <action>bake</action> for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden-brown and cooked through. For the green beans, <action>bring</action> a saucepan of salted water to the <action>boil</action>, <action>add</action> the beans and <action>cook</action> for 4-5 minutes, or until just tender. <action>Drain</action> and <action>toss</action> with the butter, then <action>season</action> with black <action>pepper</action>. To <action>serve</action>, <action>place</action> a large spoonful of pie onto each <action>plate</action> with some green beans alongside.

recipe.title: Beef and Oyster pie
recipe.instructions: <action>Season</action> the beef cubes with <action>salt</action> and black <action>pepper</action>. <action>Heat</action> a tablespoon of oil in the frying pan and <action>fry</action> the meat over a high <action>heat</action>. Do this in three batches so that you don’t overcrowd the pan, transferring the meat to a large flameproof casserole dish once it is browned all over. <action>Add</action> extra oil if the pan seems dry. In the same pan, <action>add</action> another tablespoon of oil and <action>cook</action> the shallots for 4-5 minutes, then <action>add</action> the garlic and <action>fry</action> for 30 seconds. <action>Add</action> the bacon and <action>fry</action> until slightly browned. <action>Transfer</action> the onion and bacon mixture to the casserole dish and <action>add</action> the herbs. <action>Preheat</action> the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. <action>Pour</action> the stout into the frying pan and <action>bring</action> to the <action>boil</action>, stirring to lift any stuck-on browned bits from the bottom of the pan. <action>Pour</action> the stout over the beef in the casserole dish and <action>add</action> the stock. <action>Cover</action> the casserole and <action>place</action> it in the oven for 1½-2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the sauce is reduced. Skim off any surface fat, <action>taste</action> and <action>add</action> <action>salt</action> and <action>pepper</action> if necessary, then <action>stir</action> in the cornflour paste. Put the casserole dish on the hob – don’t forget that it will be hot – and <action>simmer</action> for 1-2 minutes, stirring, until thickened. Leave to <action>cool</action>. Increase the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. To make the pastry, put the flour and <action>salt</action> in a very large bowl. <action>Grate</action> the butter and <action>stir</action> it into the flour in three batches. Gradually <action>add</action> 325ml/11fl oz cold water – you may not need it all – and <action>stir</action> with a round-bladed knife until the mixture just comes together. <action>Knead</action> the pastry <action>lightly</action> into a ball on a <action>lightly</action> floured surface and <action>set</action> aside 250g/9oz for the pie lid. Roll the <action>rest</action> of the pastry out until about 2cm/¾in larger than the dish you’re using. Line the dish with the pastry then pile in the filling, tucking the oysters in as well. <action>Brush</action> the edge of the pastry with beaten egg. Roll the remaining pastry until slightly larger than your dish and <action>gently</action> lift over the filling, pressing the edges firmly to seal, then <action>trim</action> with a sharp knife. <action>Brush</action> with beaten egg to <action>glaze</action>. Put the dish on a baking tray and <action>bake</action> for 25-30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden-brown and the filling is bubbling.

recipe.title: Breakfast Potatoes
recipe.instructions: Before you do anything, <action>freeze</action> your bacon slices that way when you're ready to prep, it'll be so much easier to <action>chop</action>! Wash the potatoes and <action>cut</action> medium <action>dice</action> into square pieces. To prevent any browning, <action>place</action> the already <action>cut</action> potatoes in a bowl filled with water. In the meantime, <action>heat</action> 1-2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high <action>heat</action>. Tilt the skillet so the oil spreads evenly. Once the oil is hot, <action>drain</action> the potatoes and <action>add</action> to the skillet. <action>Season</action> with <action>salt</action>, <action>pepper</action>, and Old Bay as needed. <action>Cook</action> for 10 minutes, stirring the potatoes often, until brown. If needed, <action>add</action> a tablespoon more of oil. <action>Chop</action> up the bacon and <action>add</action> to the potatoes. The bacon will start to <action>render</action> and the fat will begin to further <action>cook</action> the potatoes. <action>Toss</action> it up a bit! The bacon will take 5-6 minutes to crisp. Once the bacon is cooked, <action>reduce</action> the <action>heat</action> to medium-low, <action>add</action> the minced garlic and <action>toss</action>. <action>Season</action> once more. <action>Add</action> dried or fresh parsley. Control <action>heat</action> as needed. <action>Let</action> the garlic <action>cook</action> until fragrant, about one minute. Just before serving, <action>drizzle</action> over the maple syrup and <action>toss</action>. <action>Let</action> that <action>cook</action> another minute, giving the potatoes a caramelized effect. <action>Serve</action> in a <action>warm</action> bowl with a sunny side up egg!

recipe.title: 15-minute chicken & halloumi burgers
recipe.instructions:
STEP 1
Put the chicken breasts between two pieces of baking parchment and use a rolling pin to <action>gently</action> bash them until they are approximately 1cm thick. <action>Cut</action> each chicken breast into two even pieces.
STEP 2
If you're using a frying pan, <action>heat</action> two frying pans over medium-high <action>heat</action>, with one of them containing oil. <action>Fry</action> the chicken in the oiled pan for 3-4 mins on each side until they are cooked through. <action>Season</action> the chicken, <action>reduce</action> the <action>heat</action>, <action>drizzle</action> in the chilli sauce and half of the lemon <action>juice</action>, and <action>cook</action> for an additional 1-2 mins until the sauce is reduced. <action>Remove</action> the chicken from the <action>heat</action>.
STEP 3
If you're using an air-fryer, <action>preheat</action> it to 180C for 4 mins. <action>Add</action> the chicken to the air-fryer and <action>cook</action> for 12 mins. <action>Drizzle</action> over the chilli sauce and half the lemon <action>juice</action> and <action>cook</action> for an additional 1-2 mins until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is reduced. <action>Remove</action> the chicken and <action>keep</action> it <action>warm</action>. STEP 4
While the chicken is cooking, <action>toast</action> the buns in the dry frying pan for 30 seconds. <action>Transfer</action> them to a <action>plate</action>. If you're using an air fryer, put the buns in the air fryer for 1-2 mins until they are <action>warm</action>. Increase the air fryer temperature to 200C. <action>Add</action> the halloumi to the air fryer basket and <action>cook</action> for 10 mins, turning halfway through, until it's golden. <action>Toss</action> the cabbage with the mayo and the remaining lemon <action>juice</action>.
STEP 5
Spoon the hummus (or dip of your choice) into the toasted buns, then <action>top</action> with the rocket, chilli chicken, halloumi, and peppers. <action>Drizzle</action> with a little more chilli sauce, spoon over the cabbage, <action>season</action> with black <action>pepper</action>, and <action>top</action> with the bun lids. <action>Serve</action> with any extra cabbage on the side or a green salad.

recipe.title: Ayam Percik
recipe.instructions: In a blender, <action>add</action> the ingredients for the <action>spice</action> paste and <action>blend</action> until smooth. Over medium <action>heat</action>, <action>pour</action> the <action>spice</action> paste in a skillet or pan and <action>fry</action> for 10 minutes until fragrant. <action>Add</action> water or oil 1 tablespoon at a time if the paste becomes too dry. Don't burn the paste. Lower the fire slightly if needed. <action>Add</action> the cloves, cardamom, tamarind pulp, coconut milk, water, sugar and <action>salt</action>. Turn the <action>heat</action> up and <action>bring</action> the mixture to <action>boil</action>. Turn the <action>heat</action> to medium low and <action>simmer</action> for 10 minutes. <action>Stir</action> occasionally. It will <action>reduce</action> slightly. This is the marinade/sauce, so <action>taste</action> and adjust seasoning if necessary. Don't worry if it's slightly bitter. It will <action>go</action> away when roasting. When the marinade/sauce has cooled, <action>pour</action> everything over the chicken and <action>marinate</action> overnight to two days. <action>Preheat</action> the oven to 425 F. <action>Remove</action> the chicken from the marinade. Spoon the marinade onto a greased (or aluminum lined) baking sheet. Lay the chicken on <action>top</action> of the sauce (make sure the chicken covers the sauce and the sauce isn't exposed or it'll burn) and <action>spread</action> the remaining marinade on the chicken. <action>Roast</action> for 35-45 minutes or until internal temp of the thickest part of chicken is at least 175 F. <action>Let</action> chicken <action>rest</action> for 5 minutes. <action>Brush</action> the chicken with some of the oil. <action>Serve</action> chicken with the sauce over steamed rice (or coconut rice).

recipe.title: Apam balik
recipe.instructions:
<action>Mix</action> milk, oil and egg together. Sift flour, baking powder and <action>salt</action> into the mixture. <action>Stir</action> well until all ingredients are combined evenly.
<action>Spread</action> some batter onto the pan. <action>Spread</action> a thin <action>layer</action> of batter to the side of the pan. <action>Cover</action> the pan for 30-60 seconds until small air bubbles appear.
<action>Add</action> butter, <action>cream</action> corn, crushed peanuts and sugar onto the pancake. <action>Fold</action> the pancake into half once the bottom surface is browned.
<action>Cut</action> into wedges and best eaten when it is <action>warm</action>.

recipe.title: Apple & Blackberry Crumble
recipe.instructions: <action>Heat</action> oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. Tip the flour and sugar into a large bowl. <action>Add</action> the butter, then <action>rub</action> into the flour using your fingertips to make a light breadcrumb texture. Do not overwork it or the crumble will become heavy. <action>Sprinkle</action> the mixture evenly over a baking sheet and <action>bake</action> for 15 mins or until <action>lightly</action> coloured. Meanwhile, for the compote, <action>peel</action>, core and <action>cut</action> the apples into 2cm <action>dice</action>. Put the butter and sugar in a medium saucepan and <action>melt</action> together over a medium <action>heat</action>. <action>Cook</action> for 3 mins until the mixture turns to a light caramel. <action>Stir</action> in the apples and <action>cook</action> for 3 mins. <action>Add</action> the blackberries and cinnamon, and <action>cook</action> for 3 mins more. <action>Cover</action>, <action>remove</action> from the <action>heat</action>, then leave for 2-3 mins to continue cooking in the warmth of the pan. To <action>serve</action>, spoon the <action>warm</action> fruit into an ovenproof gratin dish, <action>top</action> with the crumble <action>mix</action>, then <action>reheat</action> in the oven for 5-10 mins. <action>Serve</action> with vanilla ice <action>cream</action>.

recipe.title: Mbuzi Choma (Roasted Goat)
recipe.instructions:
1. Steps for the Meat: <action>Roast</action> meat over medium <action>heat</action> for 50 minutes and <action>salt</action> it as you turn it.
2. Steps for Ugali: <action>Bring</action> the water and <action>salt</action> to a <action>boil</action> in a heavy-bottomed saucepan. <action>Stir</action> in the cornmeal slowly, letting it fall through the fingers of your hand.
3. <action>Reduce</action> <action>heat</action> to medium-low and continue stirring regularly, smashing any lumps with a spoon, until the mush pulls away from the sides of the pot and becomes very thick, about 10 minutes.
4.<action>Remove</action> from <action>heat</action> and <action>allow</action> to <action>cool</action>.
5. <action>Place</action> the ugali into a large serving bowl. Wet your hands with water, <action>form</action> a ball and <action>serve</action>.
6. Steps for Kachumbari: <action>Mix</action> the tomatoes, onions, chili and coriander leaves in a bowl.
7. <action>Serve</action> and <action>enjoy</action>!
